detailed_results.question: What decision did the Armed Forces Tribunal (AFT) make regarding Maj. Gen. Manomoy Ganguly's promotion?
detailed_results.ground_truth: The AFT directed the appellants to post Maj. Gen. Manomoy Ganguly as DGMS (Army) as expeditiously as possible and within one month from the date of the judgement.

The AFT found that his case for promotion to the rank of Captain from the rank of Commander had been duly considered and that he was not found fit for empanelment. The AFT noted that the merit of the last officer who had been empaneled was significantly higher than that of Ganguly, who stood at a much lower position on the merit list. Consequently, all of his prayers, including requests for compensation and further inquiries, were rejected, and the Tribunal deemed his application to be without merit.
